Comments: 11 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
Great earbuds that I have been using now for 5-6 years. This is my 4th or 5th pair of these headphones. I constantly lose or break my headphones from daily use and bringing them to the gym. I have found that these are a great cheap pair of headphones that sound good for most daily listening. They do not block out any noise, but they play music very clearly and without any distortion. They do not fall out of my ears at all while running.

The different color styles are a nice added bonus.
Title: Best cheap pair of headphones I have ever used

Comments: 14 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
Prior to this, I purchased the Sony MDR-E828LP Fontopia Earbuds for use with a small mp3 player I use while weightlifting. They were cheap and had good enough sound that I purchased them on numerous occasions over the years as each pair eventually became destroyed by sweat. I was disappointed to find that they were discontinued and purchased these ear buds with the expectation that they would be "pretty much the same". They're not, they have no discernable base sound. That may be fine if your using these to watch TV through a device or prefer "the transistor radio sound" but for my needs they are useless. Now I suppose I'll have to dredge through many pages and reviews to find something that suits my requirements (cheap, decent volume, reasonable sound).

EDIT: Based upon another review of these earbuds with a similar perspective to mine, I purchased the Edifier H180 earbuds. A little more expensive but much better sound IMO.
Title: Not for me

Comments: 7 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: I bought these 2 years ago after my first pair from purchased from Walmart probably 5+ years ago now bit the dust. I hate the headphones that go in the ear and I dislike the look of headphones that go over the ear. These are the only headphones I'll tolerate but stores no longer sell them. Thank you amazon! These have a 90 degree angle at the headphone jack which means I don't end up with exposed wires or sound in just one ear quite so fast. The first pair lasted me all of high school although I wasn't using them daily. The next pair has lasted me 2 years of daily use in college and now are in my pocket all day everyday at work. Which is how they ended up going through the washer and dryer. Twice. 2 years later, these still work great, no exposed wires and the only reason i'm replacing them is because I was careless and after the second wash and dry cycle, the sound on the right side occasionally goes out. My bad. Today I'll be purchasing my 3rd and 4th pairs and I will continue to purchase as long as these continue to be made.
Title: You can't go wrong with these

Comments: 6 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
These headphones are very person specific, they fit me perfectly fine and the sound quality was pretty good. My girlfriend however was a different story. After attempting to use the headphones multiple times I was repeatedly told that they were falling out of her ears and the bass quality isn't very good. They are also shorter than the previous Sony design which makes them ride "strangely" in your ear canal and make them more difficult to take out of your ear quickly without losing your grasp on them.

Coming from someone who doesn't deal with super heavy bass music I thought the headphones performed quite well for the price. However if you're looking for headphones with supreme audio and very heavy bass you might want to look elsewhere. For the price however they are well constructed and would be a good fit to any ipod, mp3 player, or even cell phone because they are compact and can go anywhere. The overall cable design is well done, and it easily provides enough length to run up your shirt or hoodie if you desire your headphones to be discreet. Are they going to be for listening to music for hours on end with supreme quality? No, probably not, but will they get the job done? Sure. If you're looking for cheap head phones with a custom color then these will probably suit you.
Title: Not bad, Not Great

Comments: 5 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: These are definitely a hit or miss type of earbuds. I had a pair of these for about 4 years until I dropped them while on a run and the buds fell off entirely. They fit my ears so well that I just bought another pair. Although, a lot of my friends who have used these have often told me they don't fit their ears very well. My ears tend to not fit the general earbud size, so these fit mine very nicely. But if your ears often fit the stick-in earbuds (like the ones SkullCandy sells), these probably will not fit as well. If your ears are like mine and can't keep those earbuds in generally, these will fit nicely.
Title: so these fit mine very nicely. But if your ears often fit the stick-in ...

Comments: 6 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
My love for these ear buds is a true love. I have been buying these exact ear buds for years now. The first time, I bought them because the ear buds that came with my iPod Classic died and I wanted something affordable but good quality. I bought them for about $10 at some local store and fell in love. They have a great length to them and are long lasting. Honestly, the reason why I've bought so many of these over the years isn't that they break - it's because I end up losing them on public transportation or among my collection of things. This style of headphones has lasted with me over the years and I know that the moment I lose (not break) the ones I currentlly have, I'll buy another pair.

Pros:
- Long cord that makes it easy for you to comfortably place your phone in your front or back pocket while listening to music. Also - great length for when you want to rest your phone on the treadmill stand while running.
- Durable - can handle more abuse than any product should be able to withstand.
- Decent sound quality. I'm no audiophile - I just want to be able to hear my music. It plays classical well enough to hear the flutes and it's decent for when you have a lot of bass.
- Price - for 10 bucks or less you can't go wrong.
- Portable - small headphones that are easy to keep with you everywhere.

Overall, I definitely recommend these headphones if you're looking for some decent headphones for a great price. Perfect for the person who takes public transit, runs, or just lives an active lifestyle.
Title: My favorite headphones - hands down.

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: After listening to a bunch of different earbuds I have, I can put them into 2 categories: Ones that sound like music, and ones that sound like music is coming out of a tin can. These, unfortunately, do not sound like music. They are "right at the lip" of the tin can, but, yes, still "in" the tin can. I bought the Sennheiser MX365's at the same time as these, and there is no comparison as to the sound quality. I have another pair of Sennheiser buds, the MX271, and both are exceptional in sound. I have a couple pairs of old walkman buds that also have a very similar sound to these Sony's. I have a cheap pair of JBL's (no model #) that sound better than the Sony's, but tonally not very well balanced and well below the quality of the Sennheisers. Do yourself a favor, and spend just a few dollars more for a whole lot better experience and buy some Sennheisers.
Title: Mediocre sound

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
A super easy and cheap replacement for my last pair. I'm not an audiophile and I' didn't want to pay a ton for watching movies on my phone. I'm also not someone that buys into name brands like Beats just because they're trendy. I needed something simple that wasn't made by a no-name company that may or may not exist in a year and these fit the bill. A great cheap alternative to more expensive options from a company you can at least immediately recognize so you don't have to worry about what corners were cut.

That being said, the sound quality is fine and even bordering on "good". The sound is about 4 stars for the price you pay. They look just like the pictures and the blue that I got are nice and subtle but bold at the same time. I hear a weird "click" sound every once in a while when I move around which I believe is coming from the headphones... or I'm going crazy only while wearing the earpieces. I'm waiting for them to tell me which it is. Until then, a perfect 4 star product that I'd gladly pay again to save a fortune.
Title: Just right for the price

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I use my phone almost exclusively via earphone, so anytime I'm around others I at least have phones with me. I use these other than a headphone as I only read the phone rather than call, etc.. In other words I don't need the "call, dial, etc" features typically.. only listening.
Due to low vision, my phone has a text-to-voice app which most wouldn't use, but it makes the phone accessible for me. I also follow podcasts and audio books a fair amount and don't like bothering others.

I find that these phones have the following advantages:
1. Inexpensive, so if I lose it or it breaks or whatever, it's a minor issue
2. Rugged.. I don't baby them and them. Once the part holding the pads snapped out of the hole and had to be pushed back on
3 .I LOVE the "handing" rather than the "in ear" type.. Much more comfortable over longer periods, adequately loud, yet don't block outside sound.. I don't like to "sound bubble" myself
4. Cord is long enough for me to comfortably put my phone in my pants and run the line up my shirt to my ears.
5. Sound is decent for an earphone of this price. At higher prices, I'd have to make a decision
I am not saying this is a perfect item, but darn good for the price. I keep a spare in case I lose or break it. I definitely would buy it again.
Title: Good, Inexpensive, "out-of-ear".. what else?

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
This will be a first impression review of 3 Sony earbuds bought at the same time:
*** MDRE9LP (the Ipod type that only sits inside the outer part of the ear)
**** MDR-EX37B (black body insertion type)
***** MDR-EX25LP (tiny unit that goes entirely into the ear)

All arrived in the typical over-engineered packaging that you can see that the designer is the only one that knows how to open without destroying the packaging. I've yet to figure out why.

Background:
My wife uses earbuds all day, home or work. Connecting to her BLU Selfie phone, her HP Laptop, her Toshiba Chromebook and her various Samsung tablets. She goes through them quickly, but we've had bad results from buying cheap buds, especially the Panasonic RPHJE120 line, which we bought 5 different colors and are all in a drawer because they don't align easily in the ear and have low output volume and very low bass... unacceptable even though they are Amazon's #1 Best Seller. She prefered to tape together some of her other broken earbuds and limp along with those instead. Her favorites to date have been the nice earbuds that came with her BLU phone and some very old ones that came with an Ipod she seldom uses anymore, but both of those are held together with scotch tape and come apart easily.

Soooo, I decided to buy one each of some Sony units to see which she liked. We both tested each using the same song at the same volume out of the phone.

She likes the EX37B ones the best (first quick use). These were priced at $13.99 and are the standard kind of L configuration. I like that they have a rugged appearance and a very good stress relief so the wires are not so likely to get damaged when she yanks them out or they get snagged on something as she rushes around while using them. To me (refined pitch perfect audiophile ears), they are a little distorted and loud, but have tremendous bass response.

Second she liked the tiny EX25LP. THEY WERE MY FAVORITE BY FAR! These were priced $14.99 and are little egg-like things that fall completely in the ear with only the thin wire coming out. My concern with these was that there is no stress relief for the wires at all, but upon trying them, we both remarked how easily they slide exactly into the right place in our ears, no alignment needed and they come out VERY easy... but do not FALL out on their own. They fit perfectly and have a very good sound, but not a huge bass note like the EX37B and our BLU phone buds.

Lastly she didn't like the MDRE9LP units that just are like little speakers that do not go into the ear canal, like so many you see and exactly like the Ipod buds she likes so much. These are hard to place properly in the ear and don't have the volume or bass quality of the other two. They are the cheaper of the trio at $8.99 and I don't see these being used unless it's a choice between those and the Panasonics.

I will UPDATE this review as problems or wonders happen. Stay tuned.

Title: Yikes

Comments: 5 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: Earbuds these days are like shirts. Everyone has them, you can get them for $1 and up. But these particular earbuds are the best quality you can buy for under $10. If you could do a sound comparison on these and the $10+ ones you will find subtle differences, but compared to any that cost $1, major differences, and these were only around $7! I like the depth of these, not tinny or compacted, there are definite deeps and lows in these compared to more treble as many others have. For a true audiophile, for the price and size they perform really well and are long enough to work while listening to your tunes. I use them on the subway train and don't really HAVE to turn them up all the way to get a rich sound with an ipod. I have two pairs because I like them so much. If you can afford these, get them. They will be your best sounding micros for the price!
Title: Great sounding pair of Earbuds for the money!!

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I was disappointed because these were not what I thought I was buying. I had the exact same experience as previous reviewer AYG from July 10th:

"I ordered MDRE9LP/BLK Earbuds. Instead of the normal Sony packaging they came in a weird little ziplock bag kind of thing with the text "Original high quality best accessories".On the back is the text "Accessories There is no best only better products. Enjoy the best quality Made in China". No mention of Sony on the packaging they came in anywhere. There is a label stuck on the back that says Sony black MADE IN CHINA. I opened them up and there are white earbuds inside, not black. They actually look more like MDRE9LP/GRAY. However, the printing on the side is so faint you can barely even see it and the parts don't seem to have a good fit. I actually had to put reading glasses on to read the logo. Sony is usually pretty good about making sure you can see their logo on their products and I don't think they usually ship them in a bag that says Best Accessories, Original High quality."

Like AYG, I got white headphones instead of black, they came in strange packaging, and the sound quality is poor. I'm not even super picky about having perfect sound--but these crackle when I listen through them. Disappointing for sure.

Title: Terrible, anything but these - trust me.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: The sound quality is just like any other ear phone. It is a bit clearer than average though. Yet, the bass quality of these earphones are low to nothing. I can barely hear any bass, yet I can't expect much for this price because it isn't one of those high performance quality headsets or something. Overall, it has a long enough cord. I'm not into the L shaped aux tip though. I guess it helps with angle and how much you turn your body. I believe it also prevents the cord from ripping and getting damaged from the end. Fits my ear pretty well without falling out. I have always liked Sony brand products. Yet, they are sometimes expensive. I'm cool with these though.
Title: This is an okay Sony product of Earphones. Works Fine.

I get very frustrated with Sony because they don't work well for very long. Quickly one side or the other quits. I bought these because reviews of most earbuds are that they don't fit or they fall out so I decided to go with these - they fit me and their price is low. I'm making do, hoping this industry can come up with something that works!
Title: I like the way these Sony earbuds fit (flat on the ...

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
One of the main problems with headphones (especially smaller or cheaper ones), is that the cord ends up getting bent (mostly in the area near the plug), resulting in poor sound, a breaking connection, or just no function at all.

It generally takes headphones a few months to a few years to get to this point. Not the case with these headphones! Right out of the box, the cord needed to be placed in a perfect position in order to have any sound output. Any slight movement caused it to cut out.

Not an issue with shipping, as they were well packed in their plastic bubble. Just a very poorly made product.
Title: Dead on arrival

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I have a pair of these that I've been using for 2 or 3 years. They sound quite good and are very compact. The stem/body (where the wires enter) is smaller than most ear buds. This has proven very useful for times when I put on hearing protection (when mowing grass for example) or when wearing a snug fitting hat. The low price makes the purchase a no-brainer.

Edited to add 1) the plug is a right-angle design, and 2) the left ear plug has a small bump on it so that you don't have to read the printed "L". This info was not provided in the product description.
Title: Very compact with very good sound quality

Title: Title

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I'm amazed by the number of positive reviews here, because I could not be more disappointed with these earbuds. Like several others, I owned and used the previous model of this product (E10LP) for years because they were both very cheap and had surprisingly good sound quality. Which is why I bought these. But I guess I should have paid more attention to the reviews beforehand, because the sound quality of these things is abysmal. Have you ever accidentally pulled your headphones partially out of the jack, and you get that really hollow sound quality, usually only coming out of one earbud? That's what these sound like. It is the most insubstantial sound I have ever gotten from a pair of headphones. As someone who usually hates the high amount of bass found in many cheap earbuds, I'm yearning for more bass here the way Oliver Twist yearns for a second helping of gruel. I can't even say "well, I guess at least I have a backup pair" because listening to music on these is physically discomforting. You might as well just hire a bum to shout songs through a tin can tied to a string.

Two stars for these only because they are functional, in the loosest sense of the word. Maybe you could get some use out of them listening to talk radio or something similar, but do yourself a favor, and buy a pair of E10LP's (which is what I just did before writing this review). There are plenty of people still selling them on Amazon.
Title: Huge step backward from previous model

Went to try to return it and says "not eligible for return." I am furious!
Title: Complete junk

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I had an older iteration of these that worked well even after I dunked them in my morning tea. The ear bud was comfortable and small. I figured I'd upgrade and ended up being just so-so. The ear piece is pretty bulky and the sound wasn't that great. I used to take walks with these and it was okay that sounds penetrated because then I could hear what was going on around me.

One fateful afternoon, not three weeks after I purchased them, I bent over to tie my shoe and when I stood up the wire wrapped around my knee, and the bud was yanked from my ear and rather dramatically whipped around and smashed onto the floor. :(

Sony brand knows their tech :)
Title: On the go earbuds!

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I used to have these exact same headphones, except they were blue! These are great headphones for a sweaty workout. I am a runner and a fitness freak. Whenever I worked out, the buds never fell out of my ears and they stayed in place.

Somehow, my blue headphones got misplaced either I threw them away by accident, they were stolen or I must have dropped it by accident somewhere. So I re-ordered new ones, and I am glad they have green ones, too. Green is my favorite color so yep! For anyone who is looking to buy headphones for a workout session to listen to your music as your run, buy these. They have a good cord length and like I said, stay in your ears.

The ones I have now, "Gummy" Sony black ones. The ear buds always fall out of my ears. As I am running, I have to reach out to the ear bud, as it falling out of my ears, and put it back in there. The cord length to my current ones are very short and they bother me because I like to run the cord underneath my shirt so it's a problem for me. I would not recommend the "Gummy" Sony earphones. Just these!

However, the sound quality for both headphones are excellent! I can't wait to get my green ones in the mail. I brought the blue ones at a K-Mart and they lasted me for two years!!
Title: Great headphones for a sweaty workout!

Title: solid

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: I purchased these to replace the ones that were originally supplied with my Walkman. I didn't need anything fancy and these are very basic, but they are comfortable and the sound is good. They are comfy enough as is, but there are also some little spongy covers included, if you prefer not to have the hard plastic right up against your skin. The cord is longer than the original ones, which has turned out to be a big help, as I tend to catch it on things. (It's nice not to have them yanked out of my ears!) Finally, the plug is L-shaped, which helps keep the plug plugged in, even when jogging, etc. I would recommend these to anyone wanting basic buds at a great price.
Title: Good Value, Basic Buds

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: Very disappointed with these headphones. I've purchased several Sony MDRE10LP earbuds, and while they ended up breaking after about a year they were comfortable and reliable until then, and while some people might not like the sound quality I couldn't tell the difference. The MDRE9LP sound is noticeably tinnier, although my ears get used to that after a while and the wires for the two earbuds separate about 18" from the earbud, significantly longer & more prone to tangling than the MDRE10LP and it doesn't have a slider to shorten it. But the reason I will not buy this model again is that the plug seems ridiculously sensitive. If the plug shifts a bit while the device it's connected to is in my pocket I get bursts of static & lower volume, which eventually turns into no volume if I don't twist or press it back. I've tried unplugging & replugging to see if it was just how I put it in, but the problem keeps recurring. I'll keep these as emergency backup headphones, but they won't be the ones I regularly use.

Title: great sound

Comments: 26 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
Sound - Well, it's nothing for an audiophile, but it's great for just about anyone else! Sound quality is crisp, smooth, no static or anything, just overall perfect. The bass isn't anything compared to iBeats but it's much better compared to Apple iPod earphones, and it's pretty good for $10.

Comparisons/Durability - 4.5 - I put these through a lot of abuse, wearing them pretty much 9-12 hours a day. This includes constant yanking out of the laptop, (they are so well-fitted in my ear, that its nearly impossible for them to yank out of my ear, thank god.), bending the wire, listening to music on-the-go (while running/walking), stepping on them, and so much more. The longest pair I had lasted about 5 months, until I accidentally dropped them in a bucket of water for hours. When I took them out, only the right side worked. The next pair I had lasted for 4 months, until my foot got caught on the wire and the left wire was disconnected from the earphone, so only the right side worked. Alongside that 2nd pair, I had purchased Skullcandy Ink'd Earbuds, which cost considerably more than these. I am not a fan of earbuds like those, and the fit was terrible regardless of which earbud size I used. The sound quality was also very poor. And alongside the Ink'd and my broken 2nd pair of Sony's, I had some JVC earphones. The sound quality was much better than Ink'd, although not as good as Sony's. Alas, the fit was rather uncomfortable. Which led me to buy yet another pair of Sony MDRE9LP Ear buds. My 3rd pair, the one I am now, is about a week old and I love them Another thing I likeabout them is how simple they look, and the colors/design of them. I've had blue, purple and now black. They are great earphones and I recommend them to anyone.

Comfortable - 5/5 - They fit great on my ears, with or without the earpads they supply.(In general, I tend to rip the earpads after a few days, but regardless of that, they are still comfy.) They have never come out so far. Regardless of how many times they've been yanked, they've always managed to stay in. It's a lightweight design and it's enough that if I don't have music playing, I'll even forget that I'm wearing them. They're not a bother and I can wear them for very long stretches at a time, the longest I've worn them being about 8-10 hours.

I recommend these to pretty much everyone, from the lightweight music listener to the diehard teenager.

Title: Not great. Was looking for a decent pair to replace ...

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
These suck. A few years ago, I bought the Sony MDRE10LP (note the slight difference in model number) and they were the best! Now, it seems like Sony doesn't make those anymore, and this is their replacement.

This new iteration is so much worse. I'm using the former model as my basis for comparison, since both were around the same price. What I did was to listen to a song with the old ones, and then play exactly the same song but using the new pair. In comparison, the bass is non-existent and the treble is weak. Sound quality is low and lacks depth. With the switch, the music sounds like the bit rate was halved.

If someone knows of a good pair of affordable ear buds that are equivalent in quality to the former MDRE10LP, please let me know.
Title: These suck. Not what they used to be.

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: Let's be real, these are inexpensive earbuds that do not have an in-ear design. If you want a pair of buds to take to the gym, go running or biking in, then these are great. When you are running or biking out in the city or outside of a gym in general, for safety reasons, you don't want earbuds that go inside your ear canal to create that "soundproof seal" that blocks all outside noise. If I am sitting on a subway or at home or on a treadmill then the situation is different and in-ear buds that create that seal are what I prefer over these ones. I use these mostly for listening to music and podcasts during exercise. They sound decent and if they get sweaty they are cheap so no big deal so they fit my needs perfectly.

Title: but were good while they lasted

Comments: 16 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
UPDATE 4/14/17: These headphones are still going strong! Still have good sound even though I use them for hours every day. The occasional crackling still happens, but it goes away if wiggle them around in the jack a bit.

There are two things I really like about these headphones: 1) the type of wire casing they use. On a lot of headphones (*cough*Apple*cough*) the rubber casing disconnects/rips exposing the wires, which I HATE. These headphones are a bit more old school in that the wires are fully encased in the tight, flexible plastic-y rubber, the kind that lasts forever. 2) the type of bud. I hate the elongated rubbery buds you have to shove deep into your ear canal. They don't fit my ears well, and are uncomfortable to use if you're laying on your side. Since I usually fall asleep with my headphones in, that's a major issue for me. These ones fit a little looser and fall out occasionally, but they're much more comfortable for me.
This is my second pair of this brand of headphones. The old ones lasted almost a year-and-a-half (wearing them daily for a majority of the day), which I found very impressive. The sound in the buds grew slowly fainter until finally one of the buds gave out. If this pair lasts as long, I will be satisfied.
The only annoying thing about these is that occasionally they crackle. That's not a deal breaker for me, though.
Title: There are two things I really like about these headphones

Title: In the less than $15 headphones arena, this is ...

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
Maybe it's just the way my ears are shaped, but these are the most comfortable earbuds I've ever owned. I've easily had them in my ears for eight to ten hours at a time without any pain whatsoever. They are so comfortable, I frequently forget that I am wearing them.

While most other earbuds come with silicon padding, these don't, and that's why I love them. I absolutely despise earbud padding; I frequently eat while watching videos with my earbuds in. Earbuds with padding amplify the sounds in my head so the sounds of chewing are louder than whatever I'm listening to. Not with these. With these, you can eat whatever you want with these in and you'll never hear yourself chew.

These are definitely the best earbuds you can buy for less than $10.

Other things that are just personal preference: these don't come with a volume control and some would say that the bass isn't very strong. Both of these things make me very happy. A volume control is unnecessary, as everything I plug these earbuds into has its own volume control, and I prefer low bass so that I can actually hear what I'm listening to.

My only complaint is that the cord could stand to be a bit longer, but that's almost never an issue for me.
Title: The only earbuds I'll ever buy

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:

Reviews: I have bought Sony earbuds for years for my iPod because of the quality of sound.This is my last time. They have already fallen apart and lasted a very short time. I don't expect them to last forever but 6 months to a year I think is reasonable. The sound is fine but the wires are thin and flimsy.. It comes apart at the earbud and it can't be put back together. I am now going to try another brand.
Title: I have always owned Sony ear buds but when I ...

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
Well, seeing the decent reviews of this productâ€”and trusting the Sony brandâ€”I thought I'd give them a shot. Mistake. I thought I was plugging them in incorrectly or something. Nope: the problem is that there is no bass response in these earbuds. I switched them back and forth between the Apple EarPods and there is NO comparison. The EarPods blow them away.

I can't wear the "in ear" type earphones that plug the canal (too dangerous for me to block out all external sound), so I guess I'll spend the thirty bucks for the real Apple deal. Maybe there's a similarly performing non-Apple product around the fifteen or twenty range? Anyway, do yourself a favor and skip these if you care at all about hearing the lower half of your music. If you only listen to lectures and don't care about natural sound, maybe you'll be fine.
Title: Zero bass. I'm not kidding.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: The headphones are durable and will last for years if well taken care of .The sound is sharp. I have had 3 pairs not because they broke but rather because I lost them . Great but for the money. I got them for $8 bucks via Amazon . I even spent $10 which is still a good buy
Title: Great but for the money

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: Quality that can be expected of a brand like SONY. They are really great top notch cheapos. Dont spend less than about $10 for a pair of buds and dont trust other no-name companies. These wont beat say a $30 pair of SONY's but they do work the sound is good and so is the base. Good for the everyday car ride/train/ commute. But obviously if you need better quality spend more money. But for me, these are just right. Cant blast them all the way up to max or you'll get a perma static and they will start to die. So as I said, top notch cheapos but if you need real high quality .. still go for SONY (I like them) or other brand and just spend more money. But my headphones take a bit of punishment over time. Yanking by mistake or taking them off when Im on pc and dropping them to the ground, not tossing carelessly but I dont really bother to set them down with the utmost care. So these are good for runners and people who work out and they might last a few months, maybe I'll update when they go dead but I dont think itll be soon as SONY does make good quality stuff. Buy them! For $10 its good bang for the buck. I will be buying again or I might move up to buying $20 SONY's, $20 SONY's are a real safe bet in terms of bang and buck.

They aren't amazing but they are what I expected.

Title: One Star

Comments: 7 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I was looking to replace my well-worn Sony MDR-E828LP ear buds that finally died. I need ear buds that don't go in the ear and block out outside noise. Although these were comparably priced to the ones I had before, these do not compare at all. I'm no audiophile, but the sound is like night and day. The bass on these is non existent. The cord also seems a lot thinner and fragile. If I hadn't destroyed the packaging trying to get these guys out, I'd be shipping the back. I'm trashing these and looking further.

Update: I just received the Sennheiser MX365 ear buds. They are just what I was looking for - reasonably priced and sound great!

Title: fast forward to 2018 and they work like when I bought them

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: Man I swear I hear things with these that I've never heard before on other speakers. They are VERY clear sounding and really make the music sound good. I prefer earbuds like these because I can listen to music at low volume and still hear what's going on around me. You can't do that with those squishy in ear speakers. They could always use more bass yes, but what do you expect from such a tiny speaker. Plus you can accidentally pull on the wires more than just one time without them breaking like most of the others seem to do. Highly recommended.
Title: Excellent sound!

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: I hate the new gel In-The-Ear buds.. they never seem to fit me. These headphones are exactly what I needed. They sit comfortably in my ear and offer a good sound for general use. They are cheap, but for their price .. They are definitely worth it! It is all relative, if you want something nicer, spend more money, if you want something to just have at a desk or in the car, or use on the bus.. It's a good product.
Title: Good Quality for the Price

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: Ok so over the period of a year ive used 4 pairs of earphones 3 from what i bought from amazon that were rated a 5 and broke and another that came with my phone. When I bought these my uncle who works for a big electronics company said that earphones with a right angle cord that you plug into the hole (i dont know what it is called so dont judge me) is good because the wire wont come out when you dangle it and wrap it etc. anyway so these have that and I really like how they have different colors. The only negative thing is the covers are easy to come off but other than that there really good personally these are like the cheap version of beats although you can hear people in them if its low it still gives you that quality of music that the beats has personally to me.
Title: There really good

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: Ordered these along with the Panasonic RP-HJE120. These Sony's have way too much treble and little to no bass reproduction. It always amazes me the difference a good set of earbuds makes vs a not so good set. The difference is not subtle. The Panasonic's do a much better job of sound reproduction, including bass without the ear piercing treble. I was surprised because Sony usually means good (I have many Sony products that are great), but not in this case. Just get the Panasonic RP-HJE120.

Reviews: How low has the bar been set for sub-$10 online electronic products? Pretty low. Received these with the left earbud not working and the right earbud's quality was just terrible. I would actually estimate that over 60% of the products I order on Amazon that are under $10 arrive defective or flat out non-operational. Under $10 however, and the manufacturers can bank that you're not going to return their product. And they win, because you won't. I'm writing this review in part to remind myself to stop being lazy and drive to the nearerst store to buy chargers and headphones!!!

Title: What are the bad reviews for?

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
When I first plugged them into my iPod and listened, I was taken by quick surprise. WHAT'S WRONG WITH THESE EARBUDS?

The sound quality was terrible. The song didn't sound good at all; there was no bass coming from these earbuds. This resulted in a tinny, weak sound. I'm not an audiophile by any means, but I can tell the difference between my old earbuds and these (and I compared them by switching them out back and forth; noticeable difference).

I wouldn't recommend these earbuds at all. Luckily, I had ordered two different pairs of earbuds from Amazon at the same time. I think you really get what you pay for. I don't like those earbuds that stick deep into your ear, so I tend to get this less intrusive form factor. If you want to stick with SONY, I'd recommend the earbuds with the case, model No. MDR-E828LP. The case isn't necessary, but the earbuds are much better. I've bought them multiple times, and they happen to be the second pair I bought along with these bad ones here. Using those right now and I'm satisfied. It costs a bit more, but it's worth the quality in my opinion. However, if you want to stick around this price range, or you want a white-based earbud, I'd go with the JVC Gummys. They have good sound quality for this form factor, and I've used them a couple times. I don't think they last very long though, as I bought these new SONY earbuds because my JVC burnt out on the left earbud. But they're cheap, and once again, you get what you pay for. Just in the case of these SONY MDRE9LPs, it's not even worth $8.

Title: THEY STILL WORK!!!!!

Comments: 100 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I currently own the Sony Mdr-E10Lp earbuds, and have re-purchased them several times (have been my favorite for years). Now that it has been over a year with my current pair it was time to get a new pair. I found that the Sony Mdr-E9Lp were the newer version of favorite earbuds, and i was expecting at least quality equal to that of the older version.

When i got the earbuds, i had nothing to complain about the packaging and product design is almost identical to the Sony Mdr-E10Lp, except the stem on the earbud itself is much shorter than its predecessor. Everything seemed fine, until i pressed play on the music with these. The sound was a disaster. There is no bass, volume of sound is dramatically decreased, sound is muffled. Even with different music and video players, there was no improvement. I was so disappointed. I don't know if i received a defective pair of earbuds or if this is what the product is. I would not recommend these, even for just music traveling needs.

Now to the hopes that I can continue to purchase the Sony Mdr-E10Lp earbuds, which offer a much better, impressive sound quality.
Title: Disappointed with Sound Quality Compared to Sony Mdr-E10Lp

Comments: 3 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: Pretty sure these are counterfeit. I ordered MDRE9LP/BLK Earbuds. Instead of the normal Sony packaging they came in a weird little ziplock bag kind of thing with the text "Original high quality best accessories".On the back is the text "Accessories There is no best only better products. Enjoy the best quality Made in China". No mention of Sony on the packaging they came in anywhere. There is a label stuck on the back that says Sony black MADE IN CHINA. I opened them up and there are white earbuds inside, not black. They actually look more like MDRE9LP/GRAY. However, the printing on the side is so faint you can barely even see it and the parts don't seem to have a good fit. I actually had to put reading glasses on to read the logo. Sony is usually pretty good about making sure you can see their logo on their products and I don't think they usually ship them in a bag that says Best Accessories, Original High quality. I am actually not totally against cheap Chinese products when I know that is what I am buying, but I shouldn't have to worry about buying counterfeit merchandise from Amazon. That is what ebay is for.
Title: Didn't get what I ordered and I think what I did get is Counterfeit

Comments: 23 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: I have used a variety of ear buds and I can honestly say these are just 'meh.' The main issue I have with these is the design of the wires going into the ear bud. If you look at the photo below you see the wire is on a rail system, however they added a gap just big enough to make the wires to the ear buds have the ability to move up and down. Because of this mobility the wire actually creates this popping sound if you move your head up and down or side to side. At first I thought it was something wrong with the audio or maybe I had my speakers too high. I tested it and on the lowest setting pops still remained if I barely moved my head. Sound overall is pleasant nothing to write home about, but it gets the job done. I must say if I had the choice of buying these again I would on the condition they fix that gap problem. Guess I will be looking for some new headphones for the new year.
Title: Design Flaw that makes me want to get a refund

Title: Hidden treasure with some little twist ;)

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: The good thing about these headphones are that they look great and are very very comfortable. The bad thing about these headphones is pretty much everything else. The sound quality of these is absolute garbage. There is no bass whatsoever and music sounds tinny. I've had to replace at least 5 of these before I realized I was stupid for buying them after I suffered the same issue with each pair. I originally bought these from my local Target which carries a lot of these in stock. The problem with these earbuds is that the cable connecting the earbuds and the 3.5mm jack is flimsy. All of my previous pairs of these earbuds died because the sound in one of the earbuds would just stop working effectively making this an earbud for only one of your ears. This is because over time, the cable would stretch and break a connection to one of the earbuds. I know what you're thinking, but I don't recklessly yank or pull my earbud cables either. I've been babying my last few pairs to try to make them last as long as possible, but each of them inevitably dies on me. In addition, the foam padding that is included in the packaging that would be used to cover the earbuds for comfort would always become loose and eventually fall out. To be honest, if you need a cheap set of earbuds, you could look literally anywhere else. BUT I would highly recommend that if you wanted to buy comfortable earbuds that look good and sound good too, invest in a pair of Apple earbuds. Just be careful of buying them online because there's a lot of fake ones around. I'm not an Apple fanboy but I can't deny that my Apple earbuds are pretty good sounding and comfortable too.

Title: Not what I ordered...

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
So, these earbuds aren't the most impressive looking I've ever seen but they have one thing going for them that all the nice headphones I've owned have not: they are incredibly durable for cheap earbuds. I tend to fall asleep every night watching something on my phone, which is a compromise I made with my partner who cannot stand having the TV on when falling asleep. This means that I have destroyed at least a dozen pairs of earbuds from just the jostling and stretching of the cord that happens over the course of a night. Without fail, I would always get a good two or three weeks of usage before they one earbud would cease working, and then another week before both earbuds were broken.

I don't even remember how I originally got these earbuds, but after a year of using them without the slightest loss in sound quality (n.b. the quality is perfectly fine for this price point, though not necessarily groundbreaking), I felt I needed to order a second set in case I ever lose them.

Now, since not everyone is odd enough to think it's fine to sleep with earbuds so you can watch Cheers until you fall asleep, this durability does pay off in other ways, specifically in surviving being in a pocket or getting twisted during a workout.

They are cheap and well worth it buy a couple pairs then if you ruin a pair or lose a pair you have a backup. They are more then cheap enough. I dont use the little foam covers that come with them not sure why anyone would bother with them. When these die i will get another pair just like them or maybe in a different color just for a change.

Title: These are my go to

So as to decaffeinate my ears, I purchased these. I just did a comparison of my old, coffee-swimming version (which still work), and these new ones. The results: this set's sound quality is horrible. I don't know what the difference is between the set I bought previously and this purchase (model numbers are the same). What I do know is that I won't buy these from this seller again and I will continue to use the set that has one bud dunked in coffee and slightly dampened sound. I can't recommend.

Title: I love these. Great quality

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I wanted headphones that were not the in ear kind because most in ear kind are noise isolating and I need to be able to hear outside as well while doing certain tasks. Also the pair of in ear headphones I have now are awesome for music but annoying at the same time because I can hear the cord moving against my chest and hear myself eating while wearing them.

So I bought these earbuds even after reading reviews stating that these headphones were tinny sounding because I wanted them specifically for listening to podcast which is just voice audio and I plan to buy separate headphones for music. They do work great for podcast but when I switched over to some bass heavy songs I have on my iPod Nano there practically is no bass. You can hear the kick of the drum but it's really light. I would have rated these 3 stars but I went to Walmart and bought a pair of JVC Gumy Earbud Headphones Model: HAF14W and those were the same price as these but they're way better overall. The JVC's are also the non in ear kind but the sound quality is significantly better than these both in terms of music and vocal only podcast. I wouldn't recommend purchasing these Sony MDRE9LP headphones but instead go with the JVC Gumy Earbud Headphones Model: HAF14W. If you're too lazy to drive to Walmart you can order them on Best Buy's website.
Title: They work but I don't recommend them.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
These headphones are exactly what you're ordering. Average quality at a below average price.

They're decent headphones, and at the price they're at, you don't have to worry about them to much if you lose them. They still function perfectly fine if one of the earpieces gets broken or cut off, the other side still works.

I use these when I don't want to worry about getting my expensive blue tooth headphones damaged, along with acting like a backup, so I've had several over the years and stash some at work and at home and my car. I have never had one stop working from wear and tear, only from accidental destruction.
Title: Average quality at a below average price - Perfect for main use or as a cheap but decent backup.

These are the second pair of these I have owned. The first pair lasted through daily use and abuse for around three years, well beyond the Ipod buds that my Ipod came with. So when they needed to be replaced, I got another pair. Great endurance for the cost and the sound is terrific as well.

Edit: WELL...this pair went bust after a couple months this time around, as the cord got yanked out of the plug. The plug last time seemed to have a better design while this one seemed to have the cords be a bit loser rather than have it be molded to the cord.
Title: So good I bought another pair.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
Being hard of hearing, I need ear buds that present clear sound. These are excellent. I also prefer the trumpet shape. The bulb type just doesn't work for me. They keep falling out of my ears. Plus, the sound presented is generally low quality.

These ear buds are well priced. So much so that, when the day after I received my order of two pairs and our new pup immediately chewed one pair and chewed the second pair the following day, I didn't have to hesitate to quickly buy two more pairs.

So I'm now struggling to remember NOT to leave them lying casually around the house. But it's going to be tough. In addition to being hard of hearing, I'm also absent minded. Good thing these ear buds are reasonably priced. I might need to order some more.
Title: Best Ear Buds for Me

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: I've been very happy with these ear buds. I mostly listen to talk radio and have found the sound quality to be very good. I like to listen to podcasts at night to help lull me to sleep. For this purpose, the ear buds have been very comfortable. I can lie on my side and not feel as if the bud is going to puncture my eardrum. They also remain in place and I usually find them intact in the morning, with no discomfort to my ears or ear lobe. There is no volume control attached to one of the wires, but that is not an issue for me. My only complaint is that it is hard to know which bud goes in which ear. They are labeled but the label is hard to read and if I am inserting the buds in the dark I do not know which bud is for which ear. I solved this problem by attaching a small piece of colored tape to the wire of the right ear bud. Hope they last a long time since I have found most ear buds stop working in about a year. If this happens, I would consider buying them again.
Title: Yes I would recommend these ear buds.

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: These were the kind of inexpensive earbuds I could buy at the grocery store before, but I haven't seen them in a while. They are my favorite type to wear because I don't like things that stick into my ear canal. These just rest at the bottom of the shell of your ear. I guess the drawback is that other people can tell you are listening to something even if they can't fully hear what it is (maybe that's not a bad thing). It's getting harder to find this type of earbud. They are very inexpensive, which is good since they seem to go missing often.
Title: My favorite kind

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: I'm not sure how these have such good positive feedback. They are simply terrible. I bought these to replace a set of Sony headphones that are failing. I needed earbuds that weren't the in-ear style that isolates outside noise, so I could still hear what was going on around me at work. I didn't need highclass sound, just something to listen to some tunes and make the day pass a little faster. These were a severe let down. They worked and are cheap. Those are the only positives. The earbud is too small for my ears, so it fell out constantly. I don't have large ear canals and most earbuds fit me fine. This is the first time I have ever bought a pair of headphones that didn't fit. The worst and most crucial part that these headphones epiclly fail on is the sound quality. They have zero bass. Like negative bass even. I played a song and switched headphones to see if it was in my head and it was like night and day between my old sony's and these headphones. And my old Sony's were not some high quality noise isolation headphones. They were just like these only with a billion times better sound and fit. These things have tiny sound, so you'll have to crank the volume to hear them and crank up the bass to even slightly make up for their total lack of bass response. Save your money.

Unfortunately, the first pair I bought were these. I listen primarily to audiobooks and podcasts; I also depend on them when exercising.

The sound may be a bit tinny in comparison with my previous pair of Sony freebies.

Title: AMAZING!!!!!!

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
After my Sony E10LP headphones stopped working after nearly 2 and a half years, I had to find a new set. I went with these, thinking that surely they were more or less the same as what I had before. Nope.

The previous version had a design that would let you tell left from right ear buds at a touch, which these lack. The other ones had a bass level that I previously hadn't realized was possible in a pair of ear buds, while these have yet to learn that such a thing exists.

Ultimately, I should have stuck with the E10LP and accepted the fact that I couldn't find them in black, rather than bothering with these. They work, they're well built, but ultimately I'm disappointed every time I use them because they're not the previous ones I had.

If I'm completely honest, I'm hoping these die soon so I can justify buying a new pair.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I ordered these and a pair of Sony MDR-PQ5 ear phones to replace my failed MDR-ED12LP phones. The ED12's fit me perfectly and sounded great and I was hoping these would be as good. The PQ5's are close, I'm not sure they sound quite as good but that may be because they don't insert into my ear as fully as the ED12's did. They're definitely not as comfortable.

On the other hand, the E9LP model sounded terrible and didn't fit my ears at all. The PQ5's stay in my ears pretty good, but the E9LP's won't stay in without using the foam covers and I ended up ripping one of the covers stretching it over the earphones. Soundwise, the E9LP's sound comparable to the Samsung phones that came with my Galaxy S4. In other words, terrible.

Title: I thought they would be fine

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
Sorry to say that the previous negative reviews are pretty much spot on. I've previously used several sets of the now discontinued MDR-E10LP and loved them. The discontinued model had excellent sound quality for the price, they were comfortable in the ear and had a flexible cable, it was also easy to tell right from left even in the dark.

The new model MDRE9LP is a disappointment for all the same reasons. Sound quality is significantly worse than the discontinued model, they don't fit my ear very well (slightly larger earpiece?), the cable is a bit more stiff and holds a kink from packaging and they are symmetric making it hard to tell right from left.

Might have gone with two stars if I was feeling generous, but that would mislead readers. These do have the short right angle connector that I like, but that's it. I'll be looking for another simple earbud... these don't do it for me. Definitely NOT recommended.
Title: Previous bad reviews pretty much spot on. These are a disappointment - nothing like the discontinued and much better MDR-E10LP.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: My goal was to get the cheapest decent earbuds that did not go "in" your ear (something makes me uncomfortable about jamming up my ear canal with foam or whatnot). These fit the bill and the sound quality is fine. My only complaint is they are shaped identical enough that you can't differentiate right from left without reading them. An alternative is to look for what side the "big" hole is on (if it's on the right, it goes in your right ear), but the hole is still not "big" enough to easily feel with your fingers. Still, I guess the sound would be in stereo anyway so the worst case scenario's not so bad.

Title: Good, basic ear buds

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
Short version: I'm sending these back because they sound "TINNY"!!! I donâ€™t know if thatâ€™s how they all are, or if I got one that slipped by Quality Control. Either way, they pale compared to the 818/828â€™s â€œTwin Turboâ€ design.
Detailed version:
I bought these because my MDR-E818 wore out at the jack from daily use/abuse, and the MDR-E818 & 828's prices went from $8 at the W* store to $20-40 after they were discontinued!!! I'll break my review down into separate categories to make it easier:
- Fit: They are very lightweight, and with/without the foam cover fit my ears OK. They are not biased, so you have to look at the shaft to see which one goes into which ear which may be a challenge while in motion (on a bike, running, etc.).
- Durability I tried these out for a couple weeks, but that's not really enough time. I am returning them for the reason below...
- Sound: This is why you buy headphones. I know you'll never get the "full, rich sound" from ear buds due to their size and the laws of physics. That being said, they are very "tinny" compared to my SanDisk OEM ear buds I use while working out, and EXTREMELY tinny when compared to the MDRE818's I use daily at work which are the ones they are supposed to replace.
Bottom line: If you want cheap, decent ear buds without the rubber â€œway into the earâ€ style, and youâ€™re not worried about super-rich sound, these are OK. If you want the best sound Iâ€™ve ever heard out of foamy style ear buds, youâ€™ll have to pay a lot for the MDRE818/828. Why Sony had to discontinue their best ear buds is beyond me.
These are going back to Amazon today. Amazonâ€™s purchase was easy, fast, they were packaged nicely, and their return policy is one of the best in the business. I purchased a pair of the Panasonic RPHJE120S, and they are about equal to my SanDisk OEM, which is better than these, but again they also pale next to the 818/828â€™s.

Title: Good regular earbuds, cute

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
My third experience of having Sony MDR-E9LP stereo earbuds headphones is still great. My first and second headphones got misplaced in Malaysia when I went back there during last two years and last year summer. As a person who is having an active lifestyle, this earbuds headphones is crafted to perfection for hectic daily activities.
The description of this earbuds stated that itsâ€™ provide â€œquality audio in an ultra-lightweight, compact design with 13.5mm neodymium drivers, an open-air design and 3.5mm chord lengthâ€. This statement could not be any truer due to my own experiences wearing these earbuds while walking, running, chilling or even cooking. The good cord length make it easy for you to comfortably place your gadgets anywhere while listening to the audio, the high standard of quality audio lets you listen to the audio without any hassle and the ultra-lightweight make it easy for you to bring it anywhere. Not to mention, the price is so cheap ($10/pair) that even if you want to replace it when it is missing, you will never think twice. As for now, I have had this earbud headphone lasting for one year and it is still working great. This shows that the durability or this earbuds is really good.
This earbud headphones comes with eight colors which are black, white, purple, grey, blue, red, green and pink. The variety of color itself will let you have choices on picking up the color that suit you best. On the earbuds, you will see the letter L and R crafted, which act as an indication for you to plug in the earbuds correctly to the side of your ears. This is because, it is designed specifically to one side of the ear. If you wear it correctly on its side, you will find that the earbud headphone will stay in place and never fall out of your ears as long as you wear it.
As you can see by yourself, this earbuds headphone is a made up using classic design. The new design is either in-ear design or headset design are preferable by some people. If you are the kind of person that did not like classic design, this earbuds is not suitable for you. However, if you are the kind of person that did not care about the design of the headphone, but others such as the audio quality, length of the chord, durability or even the price, this earbud headphone might be for you.

Hopefully, this information can help anyone that is looking for a headphone to make decision wisely before purchasing any headphones.

Title: Amazing

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
After the earbuds that came with my iPad broke, I bought this pair, as well as a pair of the Panasonic RPHJE120V In-Ear Headphone. Unexpectedly, the very inexpensive Panasonic was much better. Here's why:

- I found these Sony earbuds uncomfortable, with an awkward fit. They were coming out of my ears easily. It's like they weren't quite made right for my ears (and maybe any ears). The Panasonic were really comfortable and fit securly.

- The sound on the Panasonic was much more clear and crisp. For the Sony earbuds, when I was watching a movie I found I was missing a lot of the words, and the sounds just weren't as full, crisp and rich as with the Panasonic.

So honestly I wouldn't recommend these earbuds, but I'd suggest the Panasonic as a good quality pair at a very, very low price.

I got an estimated delivery date for my headphones and waited for them to come it. The date came and went. About a week after the later part of the date went by I went to look at the tracking and it said it had been delivered.
I contacted the company and told them what was going on. They ignored my first e-mail. After I sent a slightly angry second e-mail they responded saying that the USPS was just slow and to wait for a while. Long story short I kept writing to the company every couple weeks requesting a refund, always first e-mail being ignored, second one angrier one being brushed off. It took them about 10 weeks after the later part of the estimated delivery date to FINALLY refund my purchase. Avoid this company at all costs.

Title: Title

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
These are absolutely my favorite earbuds.
I wear earbuds at work, so I can't use in-ear headphones (too hard to hear if someone has come into my office or said my name ect). They are the most comfortable earbuds I've ever used, and fit nicely in my ear without being too snug.
They are a great price, and they last super well. I buy a couple pairs every 3 years or so, usually because I've lost my old ones. Over the years I think I've had only ever had two pairs that had one headphone stop working, and I am _not_ gentle with my earbuds.
Exactly what you want in a cheap earbud, inexpensive enough that it's not painful to re-purchase, but sturdy enough that you don't have to re-purchase because they just quit working!
Title: cheap, comfortable, durable

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I am very particular about the earbuds I use. The ones with the rubber tip that goes more into your ear canal make everything sound weird to me and the round "Gummy" ones fall out of my ears. What I hadn't noticed in the picture before ordering is that these aren't perfectly round (nor are they banana shaped like one reviewer said) and I think that helps them stay in. At least in my ears, I can't speak for anyone else.

Another issue I have with earbuds is with the cord being long enough. If I'm listening to my mp3 player and have it on my desk at work, I can move it close enough that a shorter cord doesn't matter, but when I'm listening to my scanner and having it close to me isn't an option because I'd knock it over I want a longer cord and while the cord on the MDRE9LP could be an inch or two longer, I'm glad they're not shorter. The cord is almost the "pefect" length.

Overall, I'm super happy with them after using them for only ten minutes and I'm glad I bought them.

Reviews: I purchased these ear buds as an upgrade from the really cheap ones I've been using. (The ones I have keep breaking.) So far I am really happy with the Sony Ear Buds. They are a little longer than the ones I have been using which is nice. I mainly use them to listen to music and for guided meditations. The sound is crisp and clear. The only thing I'm not happy with is that the Ear Bud covers they sent with the product are so thin that they both ripped when I tried to put them on. I have friends who paid a lot more for their Ear Buds and they aren't nearly as nice as these. I'm kind of rough on stuff so I don't know how long they will last, but given the improved sound quality I'm happy with my purchase.
Title: ) So far I am really happy with the Sony Ear Buds

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
Several years ago I purchased a little MP3 Walkman, and the sound quality was spectacular. It remained good even after my poor little earbuds made the trip through the washer and dryer. But over time and continued trauma, the sound quality did continue to degrade.
I tried several other brands and none of them even came close to the Sonys. So when I saw these I didn't really care about the price (which was very good) - I just needed some good earbuds.
These are great! Crystalline sound quality, and have that middle-of-your-head sound generation quality. :) So glad I found them!
Title: Huge quality in a tiny package

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: These are the older Sony ear buds and I like them better than the new ones that are out in the stores now. These are tougher, stronger, and sound better than the new ones. I had three pairs of the new all black ones of a big box store and in less than a month I had one pair left. I went to Amazon to see if any of the older ones were available and I found a bunh for under $10 so I bought them and have them put away because I know it will be a long time before I need to replace each pair. These are great for riding around in your travel bag because they take a beating and keep going. Nothing breaks and nothing sounds bad. They aren't for audiophiles. but for the average music fan, they work quite well.

The middle part is white, but the little piece on the outside is without a doubt grey. Not light grey, not off white, but full out grey. Both the part that says Sony and the little circle part. Luckily the person I gave them to thought they looked cooler in person than in the picture so it worked out, but it is something to keep in mind if you're looking for all white headphones. They came very nicely packaged. They are very happy and there are no regrets.
Title: Color Difference, but Still Awesome!!!

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: I have an iPod Touch, but I was never fully satisfied with the earphones it originally came with because the sound quality was sub-par. So, I hunted for a new pair, not wanting to spend more than $15. I wanted something brand new and decided to buy these earphones to replace the original pair. I've had about 3 pairs of these earbud headphones over the last 3 or 4 years and the quality has always been excellent, in my opinion. I bought these earbuds to replace the same model I'd been using for about 2 years! My old pair had been dropped, twisted, wrapped around my iPod and the quality of the sound never changed. I only replaced them because the sound finally gave out one day last week. The sound quality is really rich and clear. I only need to turn up my iPod's volume to about 50% in order to hear music or podcast with crystal clear quality. I would definitely repurchase these in the future. Shipping was also very fast too.

Reviews:
These earbuds are probably exactly what you expect. They have a comfortable fit in my ears, even when not using the included foam pads. The sound is reasonable, especially for music while working out or listening to audiobooks. The cord is longer than most cheap earbuds, and that is a definite plus.

I've used several sets of these and never had them wear out, only had to replace when my wife steals them or my cat chews through the wires. Longest time in use was probably 1.5-2 years without any problems.

I would highly recommend these if you need a cheap set of earbuds. They won't replace a $100 pair, but they were never meant to.

Title: The best ones for careless owners

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: Maybe because the phone is a Sony? I think Walkman is clearer and crisper than iTunes. But that's not the phones. I love stereo sound in my ears and need to hear what is happening around me. I have scarring on one eardrum so I won't give detail on the sound quality. They have an unusual shape and at first they seemed to fit well into my ears and not fall out. Then I found the little spongey things that made them too big and they fell out easily, so I took them off. Now they still pop out fairly easily when I'm walking about. I'm plugging them into my bluetooth clip on so there's an abundance of wire that seems to weigh, snag and pull them out. Latest engineering has the clip hanging from a safety pin and reducing the weight from pulling on the earbuds. I think I'm missing something, but these earbuds are the same configuration of wires and plug and I think I got them because they are a foot shorter than most. All the excess wire is heavy. Since I seem to be hard on these devices, they cease to function in one ear or the other I keep buying relatively inexpensive sets. I would get these again.

Title: Good ole times

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I'm a landscaper, and I go through several earbuds in a year. Because of that, I just go for the cheap ones that are under $10.

90% of the time, I purchase Sony earbuds because they give you good sound at a cheap price. Unfortunately, they failed with this set. Even worse, I bought two of them.

It's hard to explain, but the sound is not as crisp on these. The bass, or lack of, is bad. Because of that, everything sounds flat. Then, that leaves me to go and mess around with the 'EQ' settings on the iPod. That's an issue, because I have more than one genre of music on the iPod. So then I have some songs that sound good and others that sound poor. With previous Sony earbuds, I never had to worry about that. The difference in sound was negligible when it jumped from one genre to another.

When I listen to music, I have to turn up the volume a little more than I usually did with my old Sony earbuds. When I listen to podcasts, I have to raise the volume quite a bit more.

I can't complain too much because of their price, but I've certainly had way better Sony earbuds for under $10. Now I have to put up with these until they break. Both of them.

I do find them to be a comfortable pair. I'll give them that.
Title: Meh.

Comments: 3 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I was looking for a pair of earbuds without the rubbery attachments that are so common these days. I think I heard somewhere that the rubbery attachment vibrates your ear canal and can damage your hearing over time. Anyhow, these earbuds matched the profile, the reviews were good, and they were cheap ($8).

I am listening to music on these earbuds now as I write this review. The treble is OK but the bass needs some serious help. Just like Meghan Trainor I am all about that bass. For $8 I don't expect too much but my last pair of Panasonic earbuds were much better...they had much fuller sound. I will probably go and reorder my Panasonic RPHV21GA earbuds and put these wimpy Sony buds in a drawer somewhere.
Title: All About That Bass...NOT

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?

This is an authentic review. I did NOT receive this item for free or at a discount for my "unbiased review." I paid full price and am just a regular Amazon shopper just like you are.

Very lightweight plastic headphones that I keep in my bag for occasional use. I was glad to find them because those ones with the little rubber pieces that go into your ears are horrible for me. I've yet to find a pair that stay in my ears.

Sound quality is pretty good for an inexpensive set of buds.
Title: Decent carry around set of headphones

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: I love this style earbuds/headphones and would choose/recommend over the new style ANY DAY. The new style hurts like hell and is EXTREMELY uncomfortable as you have to push the "cusions" down into your eardrums. Perhaps they do give you a slight better sound and depth. I wouldn't know because the moment I had to apply a single side, I took it right out, threw them away and that was that. I'd rather have comfort than bleeding, puffy eardrums. This set is EXTREMELY comfortable. The sound is good but yes the bass isn't all that. Shocking for a Sony product.
Title: Not bad for "Stereo" earbuds/headphones

Title: No Bass, Otherwise Good

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: I've been buying this version of headphones for several years now. They're the only type in this price range that I've found to stand up to heavy long term wear. I use headphones daily (while on my laptop) and I think I break a pair about once a year on average (the only time I've ever had them break was by directly stepping on them but this has happened multiple times over the years). The rest of the time I toss my laptop around from my bed, to the table to the floor and drag hte headphones along and they hold up just fine. Plus, they stay in my ears fairly well as long as I'm not being too active.

Title: Sony earbuds

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
As much as I love these Sony Ear Buds it keeps on breaking every couple of months. I replace these earphones every year sometimes twice a year because the ear buds usually drop on the floor and the plastic piece that goes into the ear just breaks apart. I still end up buying another pair because I love these ear buds. They are very comfortable, unlike other earbuds I don't have to squeeze these earbuds into my small ears. Other ones also make my ear itchy--not sure why--these don't do that. I usually wear mines without the fabric covers that come with it. I just don't like the covers going in my ear something about it just makes my ears feel dirty.

Long story short I broke another pair of these earphones today. Mostly my fault; I'm a savage when it comes to handling these things. I'll be ordering another pair pretty soon.
