Title: Title

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
Surprisingly clear and crisp sound. I'm an avid podcast / radio listener and a lot of times the high-end in-ear headphones make voices sound muffled. With these headphones, I got consistent, sharp audio and I now use them primarily for my day to day use. And if you switch over to music, they're just as good, if not better, than iPhone earbuds, except those cost 3 times as much as these.
If you're looking for headphones that do more than just get the job done but don't want to spend a lot of money for features you won't even notice, these headphones are your best bet.
**Note, I've had these headphones and my apple ones for the same about of time, and the Apple ones have already torn, while these Sony earbuds are still like new!
Title: As good, if not better, than Apple earbuds.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: Been using these for years for cycling and running. They are not noise cancelling which is important when on the roads riding or running. Too many people zone out with headphones and don't pay attention to traffic. A great way to get killed. The sound is decent for a low priced wired headset. Sure, I have to replace them alot, I just toss them anywhere and they only last so long but for 8 bucks what do you expect?
Title: Using them for years

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I have used a Sony Walkman small AM/FM (SRF-M37W) radio for 20 years - earlier versions even had TV channels (audio only) and I prefer the SOny earbuds - no foam covering and not stuffed into your ear.

This version however breaks the FIRST time the earbud hits the ground and then it time for superglue - since I'm wearing the hip radio the wire regularly snags on a drawer knob the dog paw, whatever, but when the ear bud hits the ground the cover and the bud are separated.

Even with superglue getting a fix is tough. Looking for alternatives. Oh - forget trying to get through to Customer Service.
Title: Breaks too easily!

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: Wow, these are really, really cheap. They claim "powerful base on the go" but this is not correct. NO BASE at all... Very weak sounding, actually. The sound is very thin, if that makes any sense. The closest thing I can compare them to is the headphones that are passed out for free, on airline flights. The really cheap, no name brands. Thus, I would certainly expect more from Sony! My previous pair were Sony MDR-E828LP, which were great. Thus, I went back to the Sony name thinking they would again offer a great product. But, these aren't near as good as their predecessor. Now, I get they are sub $10 headphones, so what do you expect? I guess something that offers semi-decent sound quality. The pros, if there are any, are in the cord length, the ear comfort, and the price. But, to me, the sound quality is so poor they are just not even worthy of purchase. I'm currently listening to the $10 Apple pair of OEM EarPod headphones & these are much better than this Sony inferior product.
Title: which were great. Thus

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
These are my favorite pair of cheap earbuds. They're very comfortable and the sound is very clear. They last way longer than other earbuds. I think it has something to do with the bent input jack. It's not sticking straight out so the point where the hard connector and bendy wire meet doesn't get as much stress.
These don't go inside your ear so it doesn't block out a lot of noise. Good for when I'm working and still need to be aware of people around me.
Title: These are my favorite pair of cheap earbuds

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: These earbuds are great for the price. As a mom of preteens things like this tend to disappear. Well, for Sony ear buds for under $10 I can start stash them in a drawer or in my car and don't mind if one of my children snags them. Plus they sound great, have a well designed plug, and are comfortable to wear! The quality is almost on par with the expensive ones my Galaxy S8 came with. I'll definitely be buying again if they get lost.
Title: Great earbuds for the family

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I rarely give a 1 star on anything, but I am very disappointed in these earbuds. I've previously owned Sony MDRE828LP and MDR-E818LP, and pretty much all aspects of these are worse.

- sound quality is very tinny and a bit muffled - a huge decrease in quality compared to those other models.The fidelity is what I'd expect from a free pair of earbuds that comes with a cheap phone.
- The size of the speaker is smaller, and thus, a very loose fit in the ear. If you are moving around at all, it requires constant re-adjustment.
- The wire gauge and weight of the buds is less - cheaper construction and cheaper feel.

I bought these to replace my 828's that I wear running 2-3 times per week, which finally died after 3 years, and I simply can't stand the sound quality on these new ones. Maybe worse, the fit/weight makes them pop out of my ears constantly while running. Thus begins a new search for quality earbuds...
Title: A decrease in quality

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: I've had this type of Sony earbud for years for working out and jogging but lost them... I bought this type again because it's the best sound quality I've heard for an earbud. These newer ones are a lot more flimsy. The sound quality is still good, but the plug itself broke when the cord was pulled as my phone fell out of my pocket (only once) and now they don't work properly. My old ones went through rougher treatment, being pulled at countless times, and nothing like this ever happened. I give these 5 stars for sound quality (for an earbud) 0 stars for durability.
Title: GREAT sound quality, but not as durable as they used to be

Title: Title

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
After using several pairs of the JVC Gumy earbuds I tried this pair from Sony. The Sony pair look and feel about the same and sell for about the same price, but the sound is much muddier. By turning the treble and bass way up and the midrange way down, the Sonys can approximate the sound of the Gumys but they still don't sound quite as good.

More positively, the Sonys have an L-shaped connector which might survive longer than the Gumy's straight connector when connected to an iPod that's constantly tumbling in a runner's pocket.

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?

Title: Great product, price and service.

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: The audio quality from these earbuds is terrible. After Sony discontinued the MDR-E828LP, my favorite inexpensive earbuds, I bought these thinking that they would be of similar quality to the MDR-E828LP. Not even close. The bass on the MDR-E828LP is great considering that they are earbuds. The bass on the MDRE9LP is practically nonexistent, and they have this hollow/boxy sound that is just not pleasant to listen to. After suffering with them for 5 months, I was able to purchase 10 sets of refurbished MDR-E828LP earbuds. These will last me for a while, hopefully long enough for Sony to actually improve on the MDR-E828LP rather than put out something vastly inferior. I tested them just now, and the difference between the MDR-E828LP and MDRE9LP is incredible. I find it hard to believe that Sony would put its name on garbage like the MDRE9LP. Avoid these at all costs.
Title: Garbage

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I bought these to replace my deadâ€”and recently discontinuedâ€”Sony MDRE828LP ear buds, thinking they would be a close match, and perhaps even an evolution of the old design. (The MDRE828LP had insanely good bass for the size and clear, crisp treble and midrange sound. And at the time, they were only $5.) The shape of my ears makes high-end, rubbery, noise-canceling ear buds a no-go; I much prefer these type of ear buds.

I was sadly very mistaken. These are horrible. Mushy, muffled sound, like having cotton in your ears. No bass. Tinny. Not to mention the shape, which is uncomfortable and chunky. Unlike the old ones, these are cheap crap quality to go with the cheap price. For music, the sound is honestly unbearable. I ended up giving these away to Goodwill immediately.
Title: Audiophiles and music lovers beware.

Comments: 6 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: Shockingly bad, even for the paltry eight bucks I paid for them. You can check my reviews; I can't stand super-negative, shrill reviews based on some personal issue the reviewer has with a product. But the sound quality of these buds were, to my ears, terrible--as in no redeeming value even at the very low price point. I've had Sony ear buds before, and loved them (till they ultimately shorted out after a reasonable period of time). I'm surprised Sony would put its name on these. I knew things were not good when I opened the box and the package said "Fashion Earphones" or some such. Luckily, I also ordered the Edifier H180 Hi-Fi Stereo Earbuds at the same time. For a few extra bucks, these buds deliver significantly better sound quality. In short, if you're looking to upgrade your listening experience from . . . well anything, keep moving.
Title: Not the Answer to Anything

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: I chose these as the previous generation of Sony ear buds were my favourite. These stay in just fine when I'm jogging and I have used them about 15 times already. The only complaint I have is that the previous generation had curved pieces (arms for lack of a better term) that i could identify SIMPLY BY FEEL as left and right. These new ear buds have an "L" and an "R" indicating left and right, but you actually have to look at them each time. Soon enough, I'm sure the letters will wear off and it will be left to trial and error to see if I can get them in the appropriate ears. Aside from that one small item, these ear buds are great. Good value, good sound, good fit and durable.

Title: Title

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I subscribe to a wide variety of daily and weekly podcasts and I am constantly walking around with earbuds on. I'm sure that listening to podcasts constantly instead of loud music is better for my eardrums but it is murder on the earbuds. I have probably bought more earbuds in the last five years than five people buy in a lifetime. Since I have an Apple Nano and an iPod Touch, I was buying Apple OEM and replacement earbuds. I would buy twelve or fifteen at a time. The problem was that the earbuds might last only a week before either one side or both stopped working.

I bought a pair of these Sony earbuds a few days before Thanksgiving at a local discount store. It is now the end of January and the earbuds are still working like the day they came out of the store. And yes, they have been put through the wringer.
The sound is better than the cheaper Chinese Apple replacements, but what really seems to set these earbuds apart is the way they are constructed. The wire connections to the earbuds and the plug seem much stronger and more durable than the Apple design.
I would definitely recommend this product.

Reviews: I've used this particular model of Sony earbuds for years and had not one complaint. They normally last so long, I would not need to order another pair for at least a year or so. The order I received last week? HORRIBLE! I'm not sure if I got a bum pair, but the sound quality is barely audible. What I do hear is scratchy with no bass at all. I thought it might just be my computer (which I've never experienced a problem before with this pair of earphones), but it sounds the same way connected to my Sony Mp3 player. DISGUSTING! I'm not sure if it may have somethign to do with the seller Action Pro (fulfilled by Amazon) or what. I'm pissed because I can't return them; I trusted these earphones so much, I threw the packaging away after deliver. Ugh! Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: These ear buds don't fit nearly as well as my Sony MDRE828LP ear buds did. Sony shrunk down the diameter a little bit compared to those earbuds. Once I the little foam cover is lost, the earbud will easily slip out of position in the ear with the slightest pull of the cord. I have never seem to have been able to make the foam covers stay on longer than a week without getting lost. The angled piece of plastic which the cord comes out is much smaller and shorter than what is typical. This makes these ear buds great when you are listening in bed and your head is lying against a pillow, but no so great if you are jogging and need to re-position the ear buds in your ears.

Title: Good sound and quality

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
Don't get these if you're going to use them primarily to listen to music, even if they're a secondary pair -- the sound quality is that bad. There's absolutely no bass, and if there's any sound whatsoever in your environment, you're going to have to crank the volume all the way up to hear Your music. If podcasts are your thing, you might be OK with these as a secondary pair.

I bought them because my dog eats the rubber bits on the in-ear buds. I guess I'll just have to buy another pair of those and be more careful about leaving them around.
Title: Tinny, Tiny Sounding Earbuds

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I cannot wear the tiny in-ear buds that are so popular/common (they give me instant dizzy spells) and some of the buds in this style (coughApplecough) are either too large or too hard for my outer ear. These Sony buds are fantastic. I like them so much that I've actually stocked up a little. The sound quality is great as well. I might be approaching this in reverse, but if the buds are hurting my ears (or making me dizzy), it doesn't matter how great they sound. So I go for comfort first, sound quality second. These get high marks from me all around. Plus, as a bonus, they come in ORANGE, which matches the case for my MP3 player.

They also don't get as dingy as the "jelly-style" buds I've tried, which are comfortable, but discolor quickly.
Title: Great for fussy ears

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
It's okay. The good thing about it, it is pretty loud, stays in place while jogging, and would probably be great for an audio book.

The downside to it is that headphones lack sound quality such lack of bass. When I'm listening to music I really can't feel the bass and sound quality.

I would not recommend for listening to music, however if somebody likes to hear some good narration sound I guess go for this product.

For it's price, it does what it is suppose to do - except for the quality.
Title: For it's price, you get what you pay for.

Comments: 174 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
I subscribe to a wide variety of daily and weekly podcasts and I am constantly walking around with earbuds on. I'm sure that listening to podcasts constantly instead of loud music is better for my eardrums but it is murder on the earbuds. I have probably bought more earbuds in the last five years than five people buy in a lifetime. Since I have an Apple Nano and an iPod Touch, I was buying Apple OEM and replacement earbuds. I would buy twelve or fifteen at a time. The problem was that the earbuds might last only a week before either one side or both stopped working.

I bought a pair of these Sony earbuds a few days before Thanksgiving at a local discount store. It is now the end of January and the earbuds are still working like the day they came out of the store. And yes, they have been put through the wringer. I've snagged them on the cabinet knobs. I've lifted the iPod Touch by the wires. I have slept with them on. Both left and right are still working and they still sound great.

The sound is better than the cheaper Chinese Apple replacements, but what really seems to set these earbuds apart is the way they are constructed. The wire connections to the earbuds and the plug seem much stronger and more durable than the Apple design.

I am happy with the product. In fact, I've already ordered a supply of them from Amazon. I would definitely recommend this product.

P.S. Music sounds great on them, too! Enjoy!
Title: Inyer Ear

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
These ear buds were not good. They had a very tinny sound and the volume wasn't great; I had to turn the volume on my device WAY up compared to where it normally is just to get a comparable level. In addition to the terrible sound quality, the construction was very poor; the buds themselves were very light plastic, and the cord was very thin and easily tangled.

The only reason I give this product 2 stars is because they fit in my ear perfectly. They weren't too snug, but they hung in there very well, even on a run. That said, you can get ear buds with those same qualities and much better sound elsewhere.
Title: Terrible sound/construction, great fit

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
These earbuds are great. They are always available on amazon prime for less than $10 and come in a variety of colors. I am not an audiophile by any means, but I notice better quality out of these ear buds than from headphones up to 60-70$ (I have never bought headphones more expensive than that, so they make stack up better in some cases).

Since they are at such a low price, I didn't initially expect much. I am on my 4th pair now, after about 10 years of extensive use. My old pair is only showing some minor signs of usage, but they do need replaced every once and a while because they do go in your ear and they do have small holes.

I am always at my desk, for work or gaming, and I am always listening to music and these do the trick for a low price. I expect to purchase another pair again in a year or so.
Title: Great Earbuds, well above their price

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: I bought these ear buds specifically for working out and running errands. For $8, I would recommend these to anyone. The sound quality is pretty good for the price and they've held up well, despite being yanked out of my ears multiple times for various reasons (catching the cord on a door handle, my dog pulling them out when he's excited, etc). I've had problems in the past with other headphones where one of the earbuds dies while the other one still works, and I have not had that problem with these yet. I used to buy them at Target, where they were $15, but I bought this pair in November 2014 and recently bought another pair in August 2015 because I lost the first pair. I use these with my ipod, multiple laptops, and my samsung galaxy S3 with no problems. Good quality, but if something happens to them its not a huge loss either.
Title: Great for 8 bucks!

Also it was almost as comfortable as the Sony MDR-E818LP Fontopia Ear-Buds and much more comfortable and louder than the Panasonic RPHJE120S. Overall for the price it was a pretty good deal. I wish the Sony MDR-E818LP Fontopia Ear-Buds hadn't been discontinued and weren't so pricey now.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
All earbuds break eventually, This is due to the headphones getting old and wires growing weak. These however can last you 12-18 months before one ear stops working! i have owned other brands like panasonic and Philips that have stopped working in one ear 4-8 months time! Plus these are a bargin price and there are lots of colors.

The big reason these last so long is the headphone jack. You see the main reason they break is when the wire is bent by the headphone jack in a weird way (like wrapping it around your mp3 player) These however got the L shape jack so the wire doesn't get any stress at all! personally i think my last pair broke because i dropped my mp3 player around 5 times over the year causing the wire to catch it causing stress to it.

These headphones may be fine for listening to podcasts or the news, but I would not recommend these for listening to music. They do come with a pair of soft foam ear pads.

Title: Good Enough

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews: The first pair of these headphones I had bought on a whim at a local Big Lots for about $5, and I hadn't expected much out of them-- I had just needed some new ones for the commute to and from school. They lasted almost four years before the right side went out. It was pretty amazing to me that they had lasted through high school and into my first year of college and the abuses that came with that: being thrown into my backpack, surviving PE in 100 degree weather, rain, etc. I bought my second pair shortly after the first had died at Target for closer to $12, which is still inexpensive but more than what you can get here on Amazon. I only bought this third pair because I had thought I'd lost the second, so now I have two pairs that work wonderfully (one two years old, this one six months) that have traveled internationally in checked luggage and carry-on and have put up with the abuse of three playful kittens and an overly-excited toddler. I highly recommend these headphones for quality of sound and construction, and hope that they're still being produced three years from now!

Title: ... volume on the first level and the sound is great and extremely clear

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Reviews:
When I first plugged the headphones in and pressed "play", I literally laughed out loud at how horrible the sound quality of this product is. All kinds of music, from classical to classic rock, come out tinny and distorted, as if you were listening to a tape recording of a record, played behind a few sheets of cardboard connected to a string tied around a tin can.

The build quality is also shoddy; even the slightest brush against the cable or jack will lead to loud distortion and echoing while playing music from any kind of mp3 player or computer. This means that this item is entirely unusable while walking, let alone jogging.

This item actually makes the default iPod headphones look good in comparison. From its cheap materials (Plastic that feels weak and thin) to the lack of any features (Mic, volume control, quality audio, etc) this item is most certainly not worth even a dollar. I feel silly having paid even $7 for this piece of junk, and would definitely not purchase it again or recommend it to anyone.

DO NOT BUY.
